description.value:
Strāmecians have built up particular dexterity in their tails, becoming able to use them in ways more numerous than most. This skill makes them expert thieves and assassins, or simply great multitaskers. While it is possible to be born with a talent or dexterity that tends toward being a strāmecian, this trait is not genetic. It is, however, a skill that can be lost if not trained at a young age. It is also a skill often lost by strāmecians who go into service, where their more unique attributes get pushed down and normalized as part of training. For this reason, it is said that no strāmecian survives the army.

Adult mecians with such capabilities, regardless of their origins, are often called “strāmecians,” an insult that may be translated literally to say “street rat,” referring to a common stereotype. However, using more cultural context, it translates closer to “draft dodger,” or simply “space waster.” Despite its nastier origins, the term stuck and is now casually used to refer more broadly to any mecian who breaks the mold, even as a compliment.
Despite a more controversial military history, some strāmecians are hired or trained as specialists for their capabilities, even assassins.

system.classDetails:
Strāmecian Traits

  • Attribute Increase: Your Dexterity increases by 1.
  • Skill Proficiency: You have proficiency in Dexterity (Sleight of Hand).
